N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 5002.4 - Payment for previous service for members with a date of membership on or after September 1, 1983 but before January 1, 2010, who are eligible to purchase such service

State Regulations
(a) The
amount of money to be paid for previous service which was originally credited
under a membership dated prior to July 27, 1976 (Tier I or II) shall be as
follows: (1)
three percent of the wages
earned for service rendered prior to July 27, 1976, together with interest from

July 27, 1976 through the date of payment at the rate of five percent per annum
compounded annually; (2)
three
percent of the wages earned for service rendered on and after July 27, 1976, together with interest at the rate of five percent per annum compounded
annually from the date of such service until the date of repayment. (b) The amount of money to be paid
for previous service which was originally rendered and credited under a
membership dated on or after July 27, 1976 but before January 1, 2010 (Tier III
or IV) shall be three percent of the wages earned, together with interest from
the date of such service through the date of repayment at the rate of five
percent per annum compounded annually. (c) The amount of money to be paid for
previous service which predates the entry in the retirement system, pursuant to
subparagraph (a) or (b) of paragraph (1) of subdivision b of section
609
of the Retirement and Social Security

Law, shall be three percent of the wages earned together with interest at the
rate of five percent per annum compounded annually from the date of such
service until the date of payment. Notes
